newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Top Colombian lawman resigns to run for president.
newsitem.headline: Top Colombian lawman resigns to run for president.

text.p: Colombia's chief prosecutor, Alfonso Valdivieso, has tendered his resignation and is preparing to announce his candidacy for the presidency, sources close to Valdivieso said on Thursday.
The sources, who spoke on condition they would not be identified by name, said Valdivieso's "irrevocable" letter of resignation had been presented to the Supreme Court late on Wednesday.
Public opinion surveys have consistently shown Valdivieso, an anti-drug crusader and sworn enemy of corrupt politicians, to be the most popular public figure in Colombia.
Presidential elections will be held in May of next year and Colombian law requires that anyone in public office intending to bid for the country's top job step down a year ahead of the polls.

Valdivieso was appointed in 1994, less than two weeks after President Ernesto Samper took office amid a mushrooming scandal over charges that he received millions of dollars in drug money to finance his campaign.

He made his mark, and earned himself many enemies in Samper's government, by heading the so-called 8,000 Process -- a probe into the campaign finance scandal that nearly led to Samper's impeachment last year.
Although he is a member of Samper's ruling Liberal Party, Valdivieso, 46, is widely expected to run as an independent candidate for the presidency.

Valdivieso is a cousin of Luis Carlos Galan, a charismatic and highly popular political leader who was assassinated while campaigning for the presidency in 1989. In addition to his current post as prosecutor general, a job from which he has seen all of Colombia's cocaine kings either jailed or killed, he has served as ambassador to Israel, Education minister and senator.
Valdivieso's leading opponent for the presidency, according to a flurry of recent polls, is Interior Minister Horacio Serpa, an outspoken supporter of Samper and frequent critic of the United States.
Serpa, a firebrand populist, is expected to step down to launch his own bid to succeed Samper within a matter of days.
